result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction

ADDRESS INFO for Derek E, W Gregory I
Current: 3508 N 62nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216 United States  (Effective: 10-12-2022)
Prior: 211 North 62nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53213

Defendant Derek E, W Gregory I in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Derek E, W Gregory I.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derek E, W Gregory I in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Derek E, W Gregory I.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for deferred prosecution hearing. Defendant has completed a TAD evaluation. State is waiting on etrace. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Derek E, W Gregory I in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson on behalf of Corey R. Flynn in court for Derek E, W Gregory I.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Case is in DPA posture. Defendant needs to complete a TAD evaluation. 
Case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/11/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Derek E, W Gregory in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/09/2022@2pm
